Visualize your race

You've done the work
You are READY!

workouts.name: RACE DAY - Half Marathon
workouts.humanReadable:
RACE DAY!

HALF MARATHON - 13.1 MILES
Goal: 1:55:00 - 2:00:00

PRE-RACE:
- Wake 3 hours before start
- Breakfast: Bagel + PB + banana
- Arrive 60+ min early
- 10 min easy jog warm-up
- 4x strides
- Use porta-potty!

RACE EXECUTION:
- Start SLOW - first mile at 9:30
- Miles 1-4: 9:15-9:20 (settle in)
- Miles 5-8: 9:05-9:10 (lock in)
- Miles 9-11: 9:00-9:05 (build)
- Miles 12-13.1: Give it everything!

NUTRITION:
- Gel at miles 4 and 8
- Water at every station

YOU'VE TRAINED FOR THIS!
TRUST YOUR FITNESS!
NEGATIVE SPLIT TO THE FINISH!

run.notes: Start slower than you feel capable. The first 3 miles should feel almost too easy. Bank time in the second half, not the first. The race begins at mile 10 - save your best for then.

preRace.meal: Bagel with peanut butter, banana, and small coffee
preRace.hydration: 16-20 oz water, stop 60 min before start

nutrition.notes: Never try anything new on race day. Use the same gels you trained with. Drink water with gels, not sports drink.

hydration.preRace: 16-20 oz water 3 hours before, sip as needed until 60 min before
hydration.during: 4-6 oz at each aid station (every 2 miles)
hydration.strategy: Walk through aid stations if needed to drink properly. Lost time from walking is less than lost time from dehydration.
hydration.notes: Check your urine color morning of race - should be pale yellow. If dark, drink more in the hours before.

breakpoints.cue: You're almost to halfway - settle in
Single digits left - you've got this
5K to go - this is where you race
One mile left - give it everything

raceWeekChecklist: Lay out race outfit - nothing new!
Know the course and aid station locations
Check weather forecast and adjust clothing

taper.notes: Trust the taper. Feeling antsy and energetic is normal - that energy is for race day. Maintain intensity in short bursts, but reduce volume significantly. Sleep is your best performance enhancer this week.
